Returns: a string representation consisting of the ISO currency code together with the numeric amount
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of this object.

getNumber().Description: Returns the numeric value of this object.

Measure(java.lang.Number,android.icu.uti.Description: Constructs a new object given a number and a unit.

Returns: true if this object is equal to the given object
Parameters: Object: the reference object with which to compare.
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Returns true if the given object is equal to this object.

hashCode().Description: Returns a hashcode for this object.

getUnit().Description: Returns the unit of this object.

ClassDesc: An amount of a specified unit, consisting of a Number and a Unit. For example, a length measure consists of a Number and a length unit, such as feet or meters. Measure objects are parsed and formatted by subclasses of MeasureFormat. Measure objects are immutable. All subclasses must guarantee that. (However, subclassing is discouraged.)
